Too much weight was loaded on top of the Hazmat and the caps became loose and began to leak liquid from the closures. DescribePack: Loose cap on gallon jugs allowed fluid to leak out of the top DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: caps were tightened and box was placed under hazmat fan to draw fumes away from

item.title: Report X-2023080603
item.description:
Report X-2023080603

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking at the unload side. The package was put in hazardous bag and into a red tote. The red tote was delivered to QA cage for further inspection. DescribePack: 1 of 2 1-gallon bottles had a loose cap causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When the package was found leaking, it was placed in a hazardous bag and into a red tote.

item.title: Report E-2023080785
item.description:
Report E-2023080785

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: Jackson
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO CNW, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit, due to improper loading, a load shift occurred resulting in the release of 30 gallons of Spartan Shineline Emulsifier Plus, UN1760, from (6) 5-Gallon pails. The wooden trailer floor was impacted with product as well as asphalt outside of the trailer. HAZMAT contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup. A neutralizing agent was used during the remediation process.

item.title: Report E-2023080481
item.description:
Report E-2023080481

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-30T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 28, 2023, one (1) 1-gallon bottle of sodium hydroxide was damaged and released all its contents to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 to assess the release. E3 contained the remaining product in one (1) 55-gallon drum for consolidation. The crew deployed absorbents and neutralized the released material. All impacted absorbents, debris, and PPE were contained in a separate 55-gallon drum. Both drums were labeled and staged onsite to be profiled and disposed of by R+L.

item.title: Report X-2023080416
item.description:
Report X-2023080416

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/25/2023 at approximately 0930, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 256698 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a environmentally hazardous spill. The shipment consisted by 3 fiberboard boxes, each containing one metal can. This shipment appeared to leak due to damage from human error. All 3 packages were held and the damaged package was placed in a salvage drum and await an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report X-2023070538
item.description:
Report X-2023070538

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the unloading process a plastic jerrycan was dropped and punctured at the Memphis hub. The jerrycan struck the catwalk causing a puncture on top of the can. It was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.description:
Report X-2023070472

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-22
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Memphis spill agent was called to an outbound operations for a plastic jerrycan. The spill agent discovered a small puncture on the top of the jerrycan. The jerrycan was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023070462
item.description:
Report X-2023070462

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-22
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was called to the dangerous goods building for a leaking package. The fiberboard box was dropped during the unloading process. It contained four metal jerrycans all packaged in plastic bags. One of the four jerrycans lost the cap causing it to release all of its contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023070460
item.description:
Report X-2023070460

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was called to the Dangerous goods building for a leaking package. The spill agent was told that the package was dropped during the unloading process. Inside of the fiberboard box was a single metal can inside of a plastic bag with paper for dunnage. The top chime was dented on the metal can causing the lid to open and the contents to spill out. The package was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023070371
item.description:
Report X-2023070371

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-15
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was found during sort operations at the Memphis hub. While investigating the shipment the spill agent discovered that the metal container inside was leaking. The cap was loose causing the release. The contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023070370
item.description:
Report X-2023070370

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-07
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was offered to a spill clean up specialist located at our Memphis Hub location. During night time sort operations, ULD was opened to find a puddle under a large package. Package had fibreboard strapped to a pallet and labeled as an overpack. This over pack was covering 2 blue plastic drum containing 200 L of product. It was seen that during travel, a small hole developed on the bottom of one of the drums allowing for an estimated 3L of product to escape. It is not known when or how the hole developed. Hole was patched before drum was placed in a salvage drum. and shipper contacted for an amended shipper's declaration.

item.title: Report X-2023070317
item.description:
Report X-2023070317

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Part of a 5 piece multi piece shipment, this package was offered to the spill office at our Memphis hub location. Package consisted of a fibreboard box containing a metal can of UN 1263. Brown paper was used for dunnage. There was no positive closure nor moisture barrier reported with the package. Metal can inside was dented under top rim of can, however, there was no damage to outside box correlating to damage on can. Cause of damage is unknown, however allowed for top of cam to come loose and allow for an estimated 2.5 liters to leak. Escaped paint then leaked on remaining 4 packages. All cans were placed in a steel salvage container and shipper was contacted for an amended shipper's declaration for continued travel.

item.title: Report X-2023070109
item.description:
Report X-2023070109

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-25
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 25th, a package containing UN1263, Paint, 3, PGII was offered to the spill office since it started to leak. Upon further investigation, one of the cans inside the package became compromised and the lid came loose, allowing for the contents to spill out. The package was placed into a salvage drum, and the shipper contacted in order to determine if they wanted the shipment to continue on or if they wanted it disposed of.

item.title: Report X-2023070080
item.description:
Report X-2023070080

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered at the Memphis dangerous goods building. The fiberboard box contained four metal cans with closer rings and bubble wrap for dunnage. A lid on of the cans was damaged causing a release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be need for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023070002
item.description:
Report X-2023070002

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-24
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 23rd, a package containing UN1866 Resin Solution, 3, PGIII was found during the PM sort leaking. The lid of the inner receptacle came off causing the contents to spill. The package was cleaned and placed into a salvage drum, awaiting the shipper to come and pick up.
